Deepika Padukone Calls Marrying Ranveer Singh The Best Decision Of Her Life, Says Marriage Is Just Like Dating

Deepika Padukone Calls Marrying Ranveer Singh The Best Decision Of Her Life, Says Marriage Is Just Like Dating

In films they've done together, Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh may have been unlucky but real life is way different. They dated for six years before taking the plunge and getting married to each other in a ceremony that looked like a chapter straight out of a fairytale.

Twitter

From supporting each other professionally to just being there for each other, they've given us some serious #CoupleGoals.

Twitter

Their sizzling chemistry has remained unchanged in all these years and it just shows how love indeed does conquer all. But how different was it for Deepika and Ranveer to get married after their courtship of six years?

Talking to Femina, Deepika claimed that marrying the 'love of her life' Ranveer is one of the best decisions of her life.

She says, "It’s one of the best decisions I’ve made—that we’ve made—in our lives."

"I feel lucky because it’s like dating, except you get to see a lot more of each other. Marriage also comes with a sense of responsibility, minus the anxiety or that sense of uncertainty when you’re just dating someone, at least in our case. It’s all those lovely, beautiful things, minus the drama," she explained.

When asked if she noticed any changes after tying the knot with Ranveer, she revealed:

"I don’t know… perhaps that’s a question you should ask him! I’d like to believe that I’m either the same or I’ve gotten better. But if you ask me what those changes are, I’m not sure. But I do feel a sense of responsibility.

"It’s nice to have a partner to share your day and life with—someone you can talk to about anything. This companionship is what keeps me grounded," she added.

After working in films like Bajirao Mastani, Padmaavat and Goliyon Ki Raasleela Ram-Leela, DeepVeer will next be seen in Kabir Khan's 83. Ranveer will be seen as Kapil Dev and DP will be reprise the role of Romi Bhatia.
